Entry.173: Went to Rickmansworth in Buckingham, about 3 miles from Harefield.
Entry.174:
Harefield

Went to Northwood in Herefordshire 2½ miles from Harefield.
Entry.175:
Big Zepp raid on London.

One brought down in flames.
Entry.176:
Had a jolly fine time.

I have met some jolly fine girls lately that are great sports & I find that I get on very well with them. Some of them aren't altogether too keen on Australians as a whole, but any I have met, I find have treated me very well.
Entry.177:
Left Harefield for Epsom at 9.47. AM. & arrived there at about 1.45 P.M.

While waiting for the train at Waterloo Station I had a stroll round London. I went across the Thames at Waterloo Bridge, into the Strand, I had a stoll up & down there for a while then got into Fleet St. From there I walked to Holborn, then I walked down to Chancery Lane back to Fleet St & round through the Strand, across Waterloo bridge & home.
Entry.178:
Have settled down at Epsom, we are at 
Horsfield Road
 Woodcote Road convalescent hospital.

This afternoon I went to a party at a Mrs . She is some sort of titled lady. There was a retired Admiral there for the afternoon. We had a jolly good time of it.
Entry.182:
Went into London.

Had a look at Whitehall, Trafalgar square, Houses of Parliament, had a look through Westminster abbey. Saw the tombs of the kings & Wolfe, Pitt, Peel, Disreali , Shakespeare & many others.
Entry.184:
Epsom

Had a letter from Mac, was glad to hear that he was O.K.
Entry.190: Went into Tooting & went to the pictures
Entry.199:
Went into London via Tooting, Wimbledon, Tooting Ballham & Clapham. Had a look round Soho, Regent & Oxford St.

Stayed in London the night.

Went through Leicester Sqare .
Entry.200: Came home today via the same route, had a real good time.
Entry.201: Went into London Saw St Pauls Cathedral, Law Courts Charing Cross & much more of the heart of the City.
Entry.202: Had a look round London, Went over the Tower Bridge & saw London tower, went over the Bloody tower, saw the Crown Jewels at Wakefield tower & the dungeons & armoury at the White tower.
Entry.211: Went into London on the "Fling". Picked out the best restaurant in Regent St had a 5 course dinner with Lager & liquers which ran into 15/6, but my, it was great. I felt quite "it" amongst Colonels & all sorts of other in the army & Navy. after that I went to a picture show & managed to miss the last train home, so my evening out came to the ignominious end of a bed on the bare boards of the Y.M.C.A. hut near Waterloo station, but I was as happy as a sand boy, as I could catch a tram at 5.3 AM and after all a hard bed was not a new experience by long chalks. "We're awfull devils in the Army"- What?
Entry.212:
Woke up at 4.45 AM. caught the 5.3 train to Epsom, arrived home at 6.30 AM. The red caps were waiting on the station for us & I was the only one out of about 50 who was not caught. I came home with a sgt Major, sgt & Cpl all of whom had been caught, while I the private was grinning to myself, but its the fortune of War.

Left Epsom again at 9AM. for Perran Downs . Went to London & from there to Andover Junction where we changed for Luggershall , arriving there at 3.15 p.m & no dinner. Had to march through a mile & a half of mud to the camp where we had the usual fooling round getting settled down, before we got our tea at 5.30.

Tuesday 10 October

More fooling round, had clothing issued but no tunic or hats, I bought mine, a hat for 5/6 & a tunic for
Entry.213: Was paid £10- to go on furlough with, it's not much but I will be able to make it do. Still muddy & dismal.
Entry.214:
Left camp at 9 AM. Marched to Perham Downs to Luggershall Station where we entrained at 10 A.M. Arrived in London about 11.45 AM. Buzzed round getting some things I wanted & caught the 3.40 train to Ipswich.

Arriving there at 5.20. I met my friend, Daphne Westripp . I put up at the Queens Hotel in Queen St, dumped my luggage & sailed out, had our tea & went for a stroll.
Entry.215:
Daph & I are becoming great pals, she likes showing me round & I, as you may be sure, don't mind the showing.

We went for a trip up to Lattice Barn, explored the country a bit & came home.

Changed my lodgings to a little cottage at 60 Bath St in what is known as over Stoke.
Entry.216:
The weather was a bit dismal so we did not go too far, we found a convenient stile near Rushmere & had a long yarn.

In the Afternoon we visited the mantions , an old residence of some gentleman who made a present of it to council.
Entry.217: Another stroll along the delightful lanes & byways that abound near Ipswich. They are a never ending source of delight to me.
Entry.218:
Went to Church at a tiny little church at Rushmere.

Had a stroll in the afternoon had tea at Ringham Rd.
Entry.219: Went for a stroll in the evening, I have been hoping for a Zep raid but there is nothing doing even though the nights are dark.
Entry.220: Went to Ringham Rd to tea, there were quite a party of us. We had a real good time, though it was a very rough night outside.
Entry.221:
Had a nice long walk out in the country. Saw some chaps out pheasant shooting with beaters, I was longing for a gun myself.

Came out at "The Strand", right away down the Orwell, came home by train, had tea at the Jacobean tea rooms, after which we went to the pictures
Entry.222:
Went to see The Girl in the Taxi at the Lyceum.

The first house finished at 8.45 so we went for a stroll before coming home.
Entry.223: Daph was crook today though I think it is not serious. We put in the evening in front of the fire.
Entry.224: Wet & miserable again, no chance of being out of doors, the fire being by far the best place to be near.
Entry.225:
Went to Church again at Rushmere.

Had an afternoon inside till about 4.30 then went for a walk over the Downs to the Felixtowe Rd & home.

Spent the evening in front of the fire.
Entry.226:
Went to see Peg O' my Heart at the Lyceum.

In the afternoon we took a trip in the trainout to coming home home our trainbroke its front axil & we were nearly tipped over
Entry.227:
My last evening in Ipswich. It is a great wrench leaving a place I had got to like so much & go back to monotonous camp life with it's mud & rain mixed up with worrying Sergeants etc.

Had a quiet evening, was not feeling in the humour to do anything but take things easy & go over all the pleasant times that we have had in the fortnight.
Entry.228: Left Ipswich with a heavy heart at 9.52 AM. arived in London about 11.30. went to the bank & then to Waterloo Stn to cloak my belongings. Decided not to go to camp that day so I spent the afternoon playing billiards at the Union Jack Club, in the evening I went to see the Bing Boys at the Alhambra in Leicester Square. I then put up for the night in Totenham Court Rd, this was pretty handy for the Station in the morning.
Entry.229:
Lost my ticket, the chap said I would have to pay for another one but I said I wouldn't and I didn't.

Left London at 11.25, arrived at Perham Downs at 3.15 P.M. I didn't get into a row about being a day overdue, so consider myself lucky.

Life doesn't seem worth living after coming back off furlough to this hole. Mud up to your eyes, miserable & cold, it gives you the real dark navy blues.
Entry.230: Classified, put in here to await a draft so I suppose I shall have to fool round here for weeks. I suppose I shall live through it, but at times I doubt it, its a fair killer.
Entry.234:
Perham Downs .

Wet.

Had a long letter from Daph.

\
Entry.252:
Perham Downs 

Came on to snow.
Entry.253:
Perham Downs .

Still snowing, a couple of inches everywhere.
Entry.281: Met Max & Joe Hill they came back from Furlough last night.
Entry.292:
Left Perham Downs at 8 AM (Reveille 5 AM, Breakfast 6 AM, fall in 7 AM) Arrived at Grantham 6.15 P.M.

The road was as slippery as glass in some parts, while in others the mud was up to your ankles. We got a first rate tea when we lobbed here so its all O.K.
